title: Using MT and SF at once
body:
I`m searching for a faces with MT amd SF script, I made a bat file with extraction and searching files with both of methods (SF to aligned_sf and MT to aligned_mt).

> @echo off
> call _internal\setenv.bat
> 
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" videoed extract-video ^
>     --input-file "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst.*" ^
>     --output-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst" ^
>     --fps 0
> 
> call _internal\setenv.bat
> 
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" extract ^
>     --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst" ^
>     --output-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_sf" ^
>     --detector s3fd ^
>     --debug-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_debug_sf"
> 
> call _internal\setenv.bat
> 
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" extract ^
>     --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst" ^
>     --output-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_mt" ^
>     --detector mt ^
>     --debug-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_debug_mt"

All works well, but I can`t make works:
**5.3.other) data_dst sort by original filename.bat**

> @echo off
> call _internal\setenv.bat
> 
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" sort ^
>     --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_mt" ^
>     --by origname
> 
> call _internal\setenv.bat
> 
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" sort ^
>     --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned_sf" ^
>     --by origname
> pause  

Where is the data stored about orignial filenames ?
Merging this two directories after face detection is very helpfull, please help.
